item.title: 1st Bear in Germany in 170 Years Makes Timely Escape
item.description: The drama surrounding the first wild bear to roam Germany in over 170 years has renewed questions about how well humans and bears can coexist.

item.title: Earthshine May Help Detect Warming, Alien Life
item.description: Sunlight reflected from Earth onto the moon may hold clues to global warming and help locate Earth-like planets, scientists say.

item.title: Poaching Wars in Tibet Inspire "Mountain Patrol" Movie
item.description: Hunting the hunters, Tibetan men have risked their lives to guard rare antelopes whose wool is worth more than cashmere. Their story is the dramatic basis of a new film.

item.title: Montenegro Splits From Serbia, Redrawing Europe's Map
item.description: The last vestiges of the former Yugoslavia vanished today, as people in Montenegro voted narrowly to split from neighboring Serbia, according to early poll results.

item.title: Lion Killings Spur Fears of Regional Extinction in Kenya
item.description: Wthin two years ritual hunts and retaliatory killings by livestock herders may destroy the last lions in the shadow of Africa's Mount Kilimanjaro, experts say.

item.title: Mystery Robot Said to Solve Crimes, Find Mines in Chile
item.description: A Chilean inventor has built a machine that he claims has extraordinary capabilities for finding buried objects, from bodies to treasure. But he won't say how it works.

item.title: Hurricane Could Devastate New York, U.S. Economy, Experts Warn
item.description: Forecasters are warning that a hurricane making landfall at or near New York City could cause major problems well beyond the nation's largest city.
